result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Mary Beth Van Slate was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pursuant to the provisions of Section 343.301, of the Wisconsin Statutes, the Court orders that for a period of 36  months on  each motor vehicle for which the defendant's name appears on the vehicle's certificate of title or registration be equipped with an ignition interlock device.

Also, pursuant to the provisions of Section 343.301, of the Wisconsin Statutes, the Court further orders that for a period of 36 months, beginning on the date the Department of Transportation issues any license to the defendant granted under Ch. 343, of the Wisconsin Statutes, the defendant's operating privileges for the operation of Class D vehicles be restricted to operating vehicles that are equipped with an ignition interlock device.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Mary Beth Van Slate in court with attorney James Richard Lex.  Donald James Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea no contest to count 1 -Waiver of rights and tendering plea - Waiver free and voluntary - Factual basis exists for plea - Found guilty by court of 5th OWI - Defendant does agree that she had 4 priors - Count 2 DRI - Statments by Lex/Defendant/Court regarding sentencing - .149 BAC - Sentence withheld -3 years probation - 6 months jail with huber to commence on or before 3:00pm 6/30/16 - If revoked credit for 7 days - $600 fine plus costs/assessments - 3 years d/l revocation - 3 year IID upon reinstatement of license - Defendant will transfer vehicle to daughter today - Assessment - No intoxicants - DNA sample/surcharge - Voting rights given - Firearm possession restriction given - Post conviction rights given
